info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 06 at 5:48PM MDT by NWS GreatFalls
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northern Lewis and Clark, Teton, and northwestern Cascade Counties through 615 PM MDT... At 546 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 17 miles northwest of Augusta to near Fort Shaw. Movement was northeast at 50 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph, pea size hail, and brief heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Choteau, Fairfield, Dutton, Fort Shaw, Fort Shaw, Power, Collins, Pishkun Reservoir, Bynum, Farmington, Simms and Sun River. This includes the following highways... Interstate 15 between mile markers 294 and 321. Highway 200 between mile markers 127 and 139. Highway 287 between mile markers 44 and 64. Highway 89 between mile markers 7 and 58. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
